isis.stitle: VT 275 Engine Diagnostics Manual - Diagnostic Software Operation - Diagnostic Trouble Codes - Using Cruise Switches

note.para: Read and be familiar with all steps and time limits in this procedure before starting.

step1.para: Set parking brake.
Turn ignition switch to ON. (Do not crank the engine.)
Press and release the top of CRUISE RPM and RESUME+ switches simultaneously, within 3 seconds of turning the ignition switch on.

note.para: The top of CRUISE RPM switch is not labeled. Pressing the top of CRUISE RPM will latch the switch and illuminate a small red light at the top, indicating that cruise is on.

step1.para: Codes will flash on red warning lamp and amber caution lamp in the instrument panel.
Set parking brake.
Turn ignition switch to ON. (Do not crank the engine.)
Move slide switch from OFF to R/A and then release within 3 seconds.
Codes will flash on red and amber lamps in the instrument panel.

svcsubproc.title: Reading DTCs

step1.para: The red lamp will flash once to indicate the beginning of active DTCs.
The amber lamp will flash repeatedly, signaling active DTCs.

note.para: All DTCs are three digits. For DTCs, see Appendix B in this manual or form CGE310-1. Code 111 indicates that no faults were detected.

step1.para: Count the flashes of the amber lamp in sequence. After each digit of the code a short pause will occur.

item.para: Example: Two amber flashes, a pause, three amber flashes, a pause, and two amber flashes and a pause indicate code 232.

step1.para: For more than one DTC, the red lamp will flash once indicating the beginning of another active DTC.

After all active DTCs have flashed, the red lamp will flash twice to indicate the start of inactive DTCs. Count the flashes from the amber lamp. If there is more than one inactive code, the red lamp will flash once between each DTC.
After all DTCs have been sent, the red lamp will flash three times indicating end of DTC transmission.

svcsubproc.para: To repeat DTC transmission (for CF), press bottom CRUISE RPM switch to unlatch. Cycle the ignition switch and press and release the top of CRUISE RPM and RESUME+ switches simultaneously, within 3 seconds of turning the ignition switch on. The ECM will re-send stored DTCs.

note.para: Read and be familiar with all steps and time limits in this procedure before starting.

step1.para: Set parking brake.
Turn ignition switch to ON. (Do not crank the engine.)
Press and hold the top of CRUISE RPM and RESUME+ switches simultaneously.

note.para: The top of CRUISE RPM switch is not labeled. Pressing the top of CRUISE RPM will latch the switch and illuminate a small red light at the top, indicating that cruise is on.

step1.para: Press and release the accelerator pedal three times within six seconds of ignition switch on.
Release the RESUME+ switch and press the bottom of CRUISE RPM switch to unlatch. The inactive DTCs will clear.

note.para: Completing this procedure within three seconds of ignition switch on without turning the ignition switch off, will start "Reading DTCs".
Read and be familiar with all steps and time limits in this procedure before starting.

step1.para: Set parking brake.
Turn ignition switch to ON. (Do not crank the engine.)
Move slide switch from OFF to R/A and hold.
Press and release accelerator pedal three times within 6 seconds.
Move slide switch from R/A to OFF and codes will then clear.
